means: 抢…镜头，使相形见绌( upstage的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He had a younger brother who always publicly upstaged him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他有一个弟弟，总是公然抢他的风头。

sentence.Network_en: She was furious at being upstaged by her younger sister.
sentence.Network_cn: 她被妹妹抢去风头，感到气愤不已。

sentence.Network_en: He upstaged the other speakers by illustrating his talk with slides.
sentence.Network_cn: 他演讲中配上幻灯片,比其他演讲人更吸引听众.

list.abs: A vice president who repeatedly tried to upstage the president ., 屡次欲抢总统镜头的副总统.

list.exp: 在舞台上抢有利的位置
list.abs: steal someone’s thunder的意思是“抢某人的风头”；“在舞台上抢有利的位置”(to upstage someone)或“通过做同样的事情，破坏别人先前做该事的效果”(to destroy the effcct of.
抢劫_互动百科 ... 抢滩【 forestall】 抢戏【 upstage】 抢先【 forestall】.
They ' re much too upstage for us these days ., 他们近来对我们太势利了.

entry.tran: 在舞台后部；朝舞台后面
entry.def: When an actor is upstage or moves upstage, he or she is or moves towards the back part of the stage.

example.ex: Upstage and right of centre, Robert Morris stands with his back to the audience...
example.tran: 舞台后方偏右处，罗伯特·莫里斯背对观众站着。
在舞台后面安置一部摄影机。

entry.def: If someone upstages you, they draw attention away from you by being more attractive or interesting.

example.ex: He had a younger brother who always publicly upstaged him...
example.tran: 他有一个弟弟，总是公然抢他的风头。

example.ex: He upstages her by flirting with other women.
example.tran: 他与其他女人调情，故意怠慢她。

auth_sentence.content: Provincial doctors who felt upstaged by the snooty medical royal colleges in London.
